explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

external_accountability.findings: JLL emphasizes the importance of AI providers building tools responsibly. The company's technical paper discusses AI regulations, societal risks, and market standards, implying a need for external accountability.
external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Publish third-party audit results, certifications, or regulatory compliance documentation.

relevant_sources.summary: This JLL Insights blog post provides evidence for **external_accountability, governance, oversight, and transparency** in responsible AI. The article recommends corporate-wide Responsible Use Guidelines and workforce training, demonstrating a focus on **governance** and **oversight** by ensuring employees understand AI capabilities and limitations. It also emphasizes the importance of AI providers building tools responsibly and highlights the need for transparency in AI applications, supporting the **external_accountability** and **transparency** pillars.
relevant_sources.title: JLL Insights: AI Risk Navigation for Real Estate

relevant_sources.summary: This technical paper, "JLL Artificial Intelligence Implications Research Report," provides evidence for the **external_accountability**, **governance**, and **privacy** pillars. The report supports these pillars by discussing AI regulations, societal risks, and market standards, implying a need for governance and external accountability. It also highlights the importance of a strategic approach to mitigate AI risks and emphasizes the need for responsible and ethical AI use, indicating a focus on governance and planning for AI integration.
relevant_sources.title: JLL Artificial Intelligence Implications Research Report

fairness.path_to_improvement: Document bias testing procedures or vendor AI fairness requirements.

governance.findings: JLL mentions strategic investment in AI capabilities, implemented policies for AI use, and ongoing operational governance of AI infrastructure. The company recommends corporate-wide Responsible Use Guidelines, workforce training, and outlines proactive steps for AI integration, including defining objectives and evaluating providers. JLL also discusses AI strategy, platform implementation, and the need for data governance alongside AI adoption, highlighting a strategic approach to mitigate AI risks and emphasizing responsible and ethical AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This annual report (Form 10-K) provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. It indicates governance through mentions of strategic investment in AI capabilities, implemented policies for AI use (though lacking execution details), and ongoing operational governance of AI infrastructure. Transparency is supported by descriptions of AI/ML use in risk identification and decision-making, as well as the mention of AI tools and platforms, though these are presented narratively without detailed execution or formal commitments.
relevant_sources.title: Form 10-K 2024 Annual Report

relevant_sources.summary: This press release for the JLL Falcon AI Platform announcement provides evidence for the **governance**, **privacy**, and **transparency** pillars. It supports transparency by highlighting the AI assistant's capabilities and purpose, and by detailing its components and features. Governance is implied through the platform being described as "purpose-built" and "proprietary," suggesting internal control over its development and deployment. The press release also mentions privacy features, indicating a focus on protecting user data within the AI system.
relevant_sources.title: JLL Falcon AI Platform Launch Announcement

relevant_sources.summary: This JLL blog post, "AI for Sustainable Asset Enhancement," provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. The article supports governance by outlining proactive steps for AI integration, such as defining objectives, evaluating providers, and suggesting a structured approach to AI adoption and procurement. Transparency is evidenced by the discussion of AI capabilities and operational benefits, indicating a clear understanding of what AI can achieve and its impact on processes.
relevant_sources.title: JLL Research: AI for Sustainable Asset Enhancement

relevant_sources.summary: This JLL AI Solutions Product Page provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars. The page supports transparency by describing the AI platform's capabilities and how it empowers employees and enhances client value. It also indicates a planned approach to AI deployment through mentions of AI strategy and generative AI, suggesting a level of governance.
relevant_sources.title: JLL AI Solutions Product Page

relevant_sources.summary: This help page, "AI Generated Content Disclaimer," provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. It supports governance by outlining JLL's disclaimer of liability and its right to manage AI-generated content, as well as mandating user discretion and expert advice, indicating oversight principles. Transparency is supported by the disclaimer's description of specific use cases for AI in content generation.
relevant_sources.title: AI Generated Content Disclaimer

relevant_sources.summary: This educational guide, "JLL Guide: AI Evolution and CRE Impact," provides evidence for the **governance**, **privacy**, and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. The document supports governance by discussing AI strategy, platform implementation, and the need for data governance alongside AI adoption. It touches on privacy by emphasizing data confidentiality, security, and the connection between AI and data strategies. Transparency is evidenced through descriptions of AI agents and their functions, as well as the mention of building a proprietary AI.
relevant_sources.title: JLL Guide: AI Evolution and CRE Impact

oversight.findings: JLL recommends corporate-wide Responsible Use Guidelines and workforce training to ensure employees understand AI capabilities and limitations. The company also mandates user discretion and expert advice for AI-generated content, indicating oversight principles.

privacy.findings: JLL's privacy statement outlines data collection practices, mentions profiling for direct marketing, and references the right to object to automated processing. The company also mentions privacy features focused on protecting user data within its AI system. Educational materials emphasize data confidentiality and security in relation to AI, and reference the connection between AI and data strategies.
privacy.path_to_improvement: Publish AI-specific privacy impact assessments or data handling procedures.

relevant_sources.summary: The JLL Spark Platform Privacy Statement, a third-party privacy policy, provides evidence for the **privacy** pillar. This policy document supports the privacy pillar by outlining data collection practices and mentioning "profiling for direct marketing," which implies automated processing and the right to object.
relevant_sources.title: JLL Spark Platform Privacy Statement

JLL also discusses the need for transparency in AI applications and references building a proprietary AI.

summary.overall_findings: Jones Lang LaSalle's published materials describe operational practices in transparency, noting the annual report's description of AI/ML use in risk identification and decision-making. The company's disclosures address 5 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars, with governance materials referencing implemented policies for AI use and oversight materials recommending workforce training. Privacy and external accountability are also documented at the policy level, with privacy statements outlining data collection practices, based on a review of 10 publicly available sources. No qualifying public evidence was found for fairness or explainability.
